column1: back of a length and outside off, lets it go. Very T20 that, eh?
huge appeal for lbw as Starc gets an inswinger to thud into Banton's pads. His line is too straight though and the movement took it past the flick shot, and probably down leg side too

another maaaasssssive appeal and this one, I think, is much better. Ump says no, so Finch says review. Incredible bowling from Starc. Somewhere near his best. It's full. It's right at the stumps. It's swinging in very very late. But for all that menace, Banton is able to get an inside edge on there before it skids into his pads. Excellent spot by the on-field umpire Martin.Saggers
taps it to the left of mid-off and sprints through
wanders way down leg and it's credit to Wade's prep behind the scenes that he's able to dive across and stop five wides.
very full again, so much so that Bairstow doesn't even have to move his feet, just lean into the ball outside off and push into the covers
bouncer, and a sharp one at that, 91 mph on middle and leg. Bairstow spots it early enough and gets out of the way
fullish on middle, nudges through the square leg region
good length on middle, defends to cover
flat bats a back of a length ball, hoping to send it soaring over the bowler's head. In the end, he only splices it to mid-off
pulls through midwicket, even though he didn't have any room on offer. Bairstow is definitely going after Hazlewood here

caught behind!. Brilliant work from Hazlewood. Pitching it up. Inviting the drive. Batsmen in this format need no second invitation but Banton here finds that a little bit of away movement is enough to take his outside edge. As he walks back, he may even wonder if that was full enough to be going gung ho like that.
keeps it on a good length, gets the ball to nip in off the pitch, Malan manages an inside edge onto pad and searches for a single. His partner is too uncertain and they bail in the end
blocks a shortish ball on off stump
sweetly hit down the ground, and it needs a last-ditch dive from Richardson to stop the ball from reaching the long-off boundary
back of a length on off stump, defends
outstanding shot!. It's just tailing into his pads, slightly short, but Malan picks it up so early and swivels on his back leg to pull it away to long leg.

short of mid-on! Nearly bounces him out does Starc. Perhaps that was the plan the previous ball. Does it way better this time, getting the bouncer up towards his left shoulder. Malan goes for the pull again, but this time he's very slow on the shot, because the ball is coming for his head.
sliding down leg
drives outside off, one hand flying off the handle, as he finds third man
shimmies down the pitch to hoick Hazlewood off his good line and length, no luck. The ball just pops off the pads into the off side
swings hard and sends the back of a length ball to mid-on
fine leg is up, he goes for the bouncer, Malan hooks it, gets a top edge and it leaps away to the fine leg boundary. Decent ball, just didn't have the field for it
backs away to cut a ball aimed at middle and off stump, only for it to bounce over the top-edge. Hazlewood has one-upped the batsman very obviously coming after him over and over so far
pushes gently to mid-on and sprints through
picks up the short ball and pulls to deep square leg
pulls the back of a length ball to the left of deep square leg
follows the batsman even as he clears his front leg and looks to go big. Back of a length ball, cramping him for room, makes him mistime to midwicket
appeal for caught behind, not out says the ump immediately as Bairstow goes for a scoop and is beaten by a back of a length ball outside off stump. No review

they go up again for another caught behind. Ump says no. Finch wants more info. He's not getting anything definitive except from the keeper who urges him to go. Bairstow was going for the pull here, when he doesn't quite have the room for the shot. He's beaten. No spike on UltraEdge. Australia lose all their reviews for the innings
scuffs a pull shot to mid-on, trying to clear his front leg and crash the bowler out of the ground
short-arm pull past the left of short fine leg
pulls a back of a length ball to deep square leg
walks across to try and work a back of a length ball on off stump behind square leg. Gets struck on the pads, looks a bit high though. But Australia are gutted when the verdict is not out.
jumps outside leg and is still unable to find the gap - and this was a full toss too. Ooooh, hello. This is a no-ball. He's overstepped and the third ump's spotted it
inside edges a hoick and the low full toss on middle scurries away to the fine leg boundary. Well, that's one way to get going.

hammers it away to the deep square leg boundary. Finally one of his wild swings to the leg side hits the middle of the bat. Mysteriously enough, it's the one time he's not been moving around mad in his crease. Just a stable base to draw power from.
struck on the pad as he tries to flick into midwicket.
drives to mid-on
dabs the shortish ball to the left of short third man, where Hazlewood dives to stop a boundary
punches through cover, to the left of the sweeper, again with plenty of power once he decides to play normal cricket
walks across to cut a short ball to the sweeper
whips a length ball through midwicket
slower ball outside off, Bairstow adjusts well enough in the end to guide it to short third man
slogs a length ball, looking to go over long-on, but it's off pace again. And he's so far into his shot that he scuffs it along the ground to long-on
sweeps between deeps square leg and midwicket, but Hazlewood there tracks the ball well and tennis fore-hands it back into the field of play as he himself goes over it.
reverse sweep past point. Outstanding pick up from Malan. The ball is on a length, allowing him to get under it and power away.
goes back and pushes a good length ball to deep midwicket
cuts to short third man
cuts again and this time he picks the gap between point and short third man. Not without some degree of risk though - the ball went at catchable height.
punches through point

taken at deep midwicket! Lovely work from Stoinis, running in off the boundary, diving forward and picking up an important low catch. Just reward for Zampa who sensed Malan would go for his favourite sweep shot, held his length back, added a few extra revs to get the extra bounce that then gets the top edge. Good stuff.
turns a fuller delivery on leg stump through square leg
squeezes a drive to the left of backward point
goes back to the flatter ball and flicks to the left of deep midwicket
googly, on middle, Billings goes back and works it through midwicket
backs away to punch the shortish ball on off stump to the left of cover
goes for the slog sweep, but the ball drifts into him, and dips at the last second to sneak under his bat
nudges a full ball on leg stump to the left of short fine leg
steps out, turns a length ball into a half-volley and launches it all the way over long-on. Monster hit. Simply done.
pulls his length back and Bairstow cuts to cover
drives to long-on
defends a full ball towards midwicket for a double.
and heeeeeerrrrre's Jonny! Brutalised over deep square! Bairstow honks a mahoosive slog-sweep into the empty stands... that's an obscene hit
pushed through flat outside off, dabbed for one

tossed up, Billings reverses... gloved to slip! Zampa gets another, bit of turn and bounce and Billings' attempt to funk it through point ends up plopping a catch to Finch! Extra flight and dip for Zampa, and he gets the reward for keeping a slip in. So Billings misses out on his chance to impress
floated up from over the wicket, Moeen waits on it and taps back defensively
flighted, slightly wider and he punches through cover point
quicker, outside off and YJB drill to cover... excellent comeback in that over from Zampsta
bangs a length on off, tapped into the covers
touch shorter, 85mph/137kph and Moeen drops it down into the off side, no chance of a quick one as the field comes in
bit of width, this time he hangs back and glides to third man
fired in straight, 84mph/136kph and deflected behind square on the leg side
ramped for four! Cute stuff from Moeen, sits back and uses the pace, sends it fine of third man
dug in short, 84mph at the sternum and this results in some evasive action... decent showing from Hazlewood tonight
looped up on off, prodded away
straighter, this one the Bosie and Bairstow is down to slog-sweep, gets a thick inside edge through backward square leg
comes down, drilled to long-off, struck that powerfully but scudded low to the man set back
blootered! YJB steps down and kabooms this over long-off! Bouncing into the empty seats, that is fifty for Bairstow... First in six T20I innings, reward for battling through
tossed up on the stumps and he sweeps in orthodox fashion for one
pushed through and Moeen taps away on leg stump
flat and fast outside off, mistimed on the cut as he drops back and cover sweeps it up
length ball, Moeen swings for the hills, misses and the balls thuds into the back leg... pitched outside leg? He'd also come a long way down

slogs leg side, top-edged towards the ring... and Agar hunts it down for the c&b! He's struggled for timing, despite scoring a crunchy fifty, and Bairstow won't be going on tonight. Excellent running catch from Agar, with the ball looping towards no man's land
dragged down but Moeen swats it back towards the bowler, who cuts it off to his left
attempts to come down, Agar spears it leg side and Moeen manages to get something in the way

sliced off the back foot, using the pace from Agar, Zampa scrambles across from short third man... can't prevent it from running away! Moeen picks up four from the last ball of an otherwise decent over
flighted legbreak, spinning on middle and leg, Denly blocks it half forward
flatter and he's back on off stump to cut one to the deep point sweeper
Mo mows, straight back down the ground! Skipped out and hooned this into the sight screen for a flat six
fired in quick and he flicks off the pads coming forward
Denly tries to use the feet, Zampa slows his pace up, the googly nearly sneaks through between bat and pad... just manages to keep it out, otherwise he was in stumping country
slap-sliced up and over, gets it away to the rope at deep extra cover! Not a clean strike from Denly but he got just about enough on it
flat outside off from round the wicket and Moeen cuts for one
tossed up, Denly is forward and lofting over point for a single
shortish on leg stump, Moeen hoicks through the leg side, only a single to the boundary rider
fired in quick, 65mph and bouncing over the top of leg stump as Denly makes room trying to cut!
quick and flat and he gets this one away off the back foot through point
tossed up and Moeen opens up, chips down the ground, clears the bowler and long-off has to come around
round the wicket, full and wide of the stumps and squirted through backward point
over the wicket, length ball and it wobbles back in towards off stump as Moeen thrashes at it and misses
fired full on leg stump, 93mph/149kph and Moeen clips it away towards deep midwicket for one
round the wicket, again, 91mph/147kph and drilled down the ground to long-on

swung high into the leg side, Smith is under it at deep midwicket... taken on rope despite a juggle! Or was it? The TV umpire is going to take a long look at this. Smith was very close as he took catch, his heel right on the boundary marker, and did it just touch? He then tossed the ball up and walked in to catch it a second time, just to be sure. But there's no conclusive evidence and after a moment's deliberation, David Millns is happy to send Moeen on his way
fired in full at 90+ mph again, dug out into the covers for one
short, pace off the ball, Denly has to reach for the pull and does well to pick up two into the leg side
chopped past his stumps! Makes room for a back-foot hack and beats Wade's dive to pick up four!
edged wide of the keeper this time, but played in deliberate fashion to another slower ball! Nicely done, back-to-back fours for Denly
pace off, wide of the stumps, sliced past Wade for four more! Don't think he was really aiming there on this occasion, tried a forcing short but got it between keeper and short third man again
pitched up, 88mph/141kph and he bunts this into the covers
pitched up on the stumps, pace on again, 88mph and Jordan inside-edges to fine leg
back of a length from round the wicket, 88mph/141kph and jabbed down into the off side, Starc lopes after it
full, 90mph/145kph and Jordan lifts it up and over cover point to the sweeper
full and straight at 91mph/147kph, bunted down to long-on, only a single there
cranking it up, 92mph/148kph yorker, slightly leg side and Jordan can only dig it out towards midwicket... Starc again hurtles after it in his follow through to keep them to a single

sconed him! Short and nasty, clonked right on the top of the lid before rebounding to point on the bounce! Denly stepped away leg side, Starc followed him with a fearsome bouncer, took a bit of glove on the way on to his helmet, I think... there'll be a short delay while he gets checked out
full and fast on off stump, Jordan swipes it towards mid-off and they scamper one... Just five off the over, giving Starc excellent figures of 1 for 20
Jordan holes out to long-on! No pace on the ball from Richardson, swatted hard down the ground as Jordan hung back, but Smith is there, running around to take a comfortable catch
pace on, right up in the blockhole and Denly carves it away to midwicket for one
short of a length, 79mph/127kph and Curran swings a pull to deep midwicket
full and wide, slower ball again and Denly is down on one knee, plinks a drive to extra cover
cutter on the pads, gets away with this as Curran swings and it flicks the pad on the way down the leg side
good ball to finish, hits a length and Curran can only swat it towards mid-off for a single to finish - meaning Australia will need 146 to win and retain their No. 1 ranking
92.7 mph, cramps him with a shortish ball at the body, he works it away to long leg
picks up the short ball and launches it away to the deep square leg boundary. Outstanding shot. Saw it so early
a little glove and even that little, at this pace, is enough to run away to the boundary behind the keeper. Pull shot to a short ball at the body and no matter the mis-hit, it runs away
smashes it down the ground and would have been four too had it not thudded right into his partner Finch at the non-strikers' end.

picks it up and swipes it away over deep square leg, and it's been hit so well its gone into the signage, towering over the very back of the stands. What a shot. What a pick up. What a way to start the innings off. 91m six.
low full toss tailing into Finch, who is just about able to flick it through square leg
drives down the ground to mid-on
blocks a fast one on middle stump. 148 kph from Wood
defends a good length ball at 143 kph on off stump. Finch is staying back, waiting for the short one, so he can't readily attack these deliveries. His balance is all wrong for that.
looks to power a fuller ball on leg stump, at 149 kph, but it's mistimed to mid-on

a touch too full and a little too leg side and Finch is able to whip it over midwicket and into the boundary. That should feel good for the Australia captain. He was hoping the ball would come onto the bat under lights.
works a 151 kph delivery on leg stump away to long leg
legcutter that, bringing his pace down from 95 mph to 79mph. Finch taps it through the covers
walks across his stumps and misses a 93 mph low full toss outside off. Wade's not too thrilled with that.
pulls a back of a length ball at 80 mph to midwicket. Moeen's there, diving to his right to try and get underneath the ball to pull off the catch. But it bounces too early, giving him no chance

89 mph short ball takes a top edge (off a pull shot) and sails away for six. Archer stares at it in disbelief. He had the batsman beat. For pace. For bounce. For everything. And yet it's six against his name with fine leg up
legcutter at 80mph that flicks the pad through to the keeper

taken at mid-on! A skiddy back of a length ball across the left-hander. At 91 mph too. Wade tries to lift it over the fielder, but he can't get under the ball, it's too quickly onto him and he only splices it to Jordan
93mph, back of a length on of stump, defemds.
90mph, drives the full ball to cover
leans back and cuts an 89 mph delivery to point. Hoped to beat him on his left, but couldn't
bouncer that goes a little down leg. Might have been bouncing too high too, Whatever the case, this 88 mph ball is a wide
90mph, shortish on off stump, blocks it.

launches it over the top of the bowler's head. It's 94 mph, but it's length and Stoinis wades into it, his front foot going towards the line of the ball and those strong shoulders power right through the line.
cuts the back of a length ball away to the sweeper
blocks an 84 kph delivery on off stump into the covers
muscles it way. It isn't all that short. It is on off stump. Not too many people would consider that a bad ball. But Stoinis does and he pulls it to the deep midwicket boundary

lifts it over mid-off, just about. Archer is the man running back and to his left, reaching out for it, but he couldn't get there. Stoinis survives after splicing a length ball that he really should have put into orbit
thunderous strike! Half-volley gets the treatment as Stoinis gets under it and powers away an on-drive. That's a non-striker killer. Good thing Finch was somewhere near the grass as he was backing up
picks the slower ball and swivel pulls it to long leg

hits it right through point! He doesn't have room to free the arms, but he's clearly seeing it better than anyone else out there. Sways his body out of the way and carves it so powerfully it goes right through Banton
back of a length ball on middle and off, defends
picks up the bouncer, even though it's 91 mph, and pulls it over short fine leg. He's loving this extra pace.
blocks a shortish delivery into the covers
pushes a good length ball to mid-off

pierces the gap to the left of cover point, Denly unable to stop a sweetly timed punch from Finch. Australia would have wanted a Powerplay like this so dearly at the break. Now that they have it, will they be able to see this chase through?
steps out of his crease, prompting Rashid to pull his length back and drag his line wide. Stoinis adjusts and drives along the ground to long-off
rocks back and cuts strongly between the sweeper and long-off. That's another top shot from the Australian captain. And this one is off a slower bowler, who should be a huge threat on this pitch
out the front of the hand this time, Finch backs away and cuts to the sweeper
defends a good length ball outside off. Gets an outside edge to point

dropped And it's a dolly too! Poor Jonny Bairstow. And he'll feel the sting of an audible awwww from Rashid, who was tracking the ball too. The legspinner had secured a mis-hit, with a loopy legbreak that made Finch hit across the line. The sweep shot gets the top edge thanks to some dip and turn. It should have been a straightforward wicket. But...

another mis-hit, and it's taken at deep square leg. Banton's the man there, keeping his eyes on a ball swirling in the air and in the end diving to his left to keep hold of it. Curran's slower ball, the one out the back of the hand, messes with Stoinis' shape. He's into the big slog too early and ends up walking back
nudges a good length ball into midwicket. Maxwell, the new bat, is in trouble, a direct hit from Billings might have had him!
defends a back of a length ball on off stump
good length on off stump, defends. Another back of the hand slower ball, btw.
stops on the pitch, making him chip a drive over the infield and to the sweeper. Another sign that slower balls are the way to go here
taps a back of a length ball through the covers
picks the legbreak and carves it away to the sweeper
drives the tossed up ball to the left of long-off
lashes it to the sweeper again
walks across his crease, waiting for the wrong 'un to turn and then flicking it behind square leg
sweeps at a googly, gets a top edge which evades short fine leg running to his left. Wood really did have no chance there.
misses a wide full toss. He just misses it.
pulls a short ball to the left of short midwwicket.
bouncer outside off, Maxwell thinks about dragging it leg side, but then ignores it in the end
punches a shortish delivery on off stump to short cover
nudges a length ball to the left of midwicket
works a shortish slower ball into the midwicket region and since everyone there is in the deep, they pinch two
cuts the back of a length ball to the sweeper. They get through for a second again - a risky second. A better throw would have been tight.
full and flighted, outside off and Maxwell attempts to reverse-sweep, sends it to slip on the bounce

shocker! Maxwell goes, reverse-scooping straight to backward point! He jumped around early, signalling what he want to do, but got in an awful tangle tying to thrash it over the off side and sent a steepling chance to Curran on the edge of the ring!
floated up and tapped into the covers

slider down the leg side, Finch sweeps at it and Bairstow bellows out an insistent appeal! Not given, umpire Saggers signals wide, but England review. Did Finch catch up with it on the way past? No, says the technology! Very close but he didn't get anything on it

bowled 'im through the gate! Rashid bags his man this time, tosses up the googly and Finch is rumbled trying to hit inside out and completely losing his shape! Spins back, smacks into leg stump and Finch is gone... two in the over for Rashid, is this where the chase turns?
pushes through the straighter one, Marsh is back and flicks leg side, they come back for two as deep midwicket comes in
tosses up another wrong'un wide of off stump, mistimed on the drive into the covers
tossed up, legbreak on middle and leg, swatted own the ground to long-on
edged through Malan's hands at slip! Forcing shot off the back foot and Marsh steered it to the right of Malan, who couldn't quite get his paws up in time! Runs away to third man for four, too
flighted, straightening on the stumps, dabbed back
goes back and punches down to long-on
tossed up, Smith is forward and drives this to long-on for another single
floated up full outside off and Marsh punches through mid-off

goes to Malan and again he puts it down... but I don't think there was an edge on this one! Big spin, beat the bat as Marsh went hard at it, Malan juggled the ball and nearly caught it between his ankles before it hit the ground
tossed up straight and clipped down the ground
pushed through and Smith paddles it square on the leg side for one
big googly, wide of the stumps and Marsh lets it spin through
comes forward and punches one

chipped back, Rashid grabs another! Smith closes the face and gets a low leading edge, just carries! Rashid gets a wicket from the final ball of his spell yet again, and Australia are having a full-blown wobble right now
over the wicket, pushed through on the stumps and clipped leg side
round the wicket, flat offbreak and Agar cuts forcefully for one
dragged down slightly on the stumps, Marsh jumps back and shovels leg side
tossed up and Agar again opens up and swipes through square on the off side
flighted, tucked straight to midwicket for a dot
on the stumps, Marsh works this through square on the leg side, Billings keeps them to one
length on the stumps, Marsh hops across and works to leg
goes round the wicket, full length, 89mph/143kph and Agar slices a drive for a couple behind point
on the pads, 88mph and Agar clips this through backward square leg, Rashid has to run around from fine and they get two more
slower delivery, on the stumps and nurdled to midwicket for one
bumper, hurled down outside off stump, screaming over Marsh's right shoulder as he pulls at it unsuccessfully
another slower ball, worked off the back foot for one into the leg side
nailed over cow corner for a flat six! Wood digs it in but Marsh was waiting for it and properly smoked his pull
skidding on, length outside off and he chops it into the ground wide of his timbers
on the stumps, 85mph/137kph and he flicks leg side, another poor bit of fielding allows them to come back for two
full and wide, creamed through point! Width on off and Marsh latches on to a square drive, sends it racing away
pitched up and driven, picks out the man in the covers
85mph/137kph, short and down the leg side, wide ball
back of a length, 88mph/142kph and Marsh casually nudges it down to the on side for one
slower ball, skipping up around Marsh's hip, fended away through backward square leg
round the wicket, pace off and Agar works it around the corner for one
dug in short, just 71mph and Marsh has to check his pull, swung away behind square for a couple more
pace off in the channel outside off, Marsh taps it down into the covers for one more
fired down the leg side, flicks the pad, I think, on its way through... England appeal for a catch, but get a dot
fullish from round the wicket, driven straight to midwicket - just five from the over, but Australia are edging closer
length in the channel, slower ball and Marsh miscues it into the turf towards point, scampers one
full and wide and swatted through cover point to the boundary rider
pitched up, 84mph/135kph in the corridor and Marsh plinks this to cover, won't get one
full and straight, 88mph/141kph but hie's equal to this, punched down the ground to long-on
nudged off his hip, mid-on swoops, tight at the non-striker's end as Malan turns and fires in a throw... misses!
slower again, Marsh pulls into the ground towards midwicket, ricochets through and they'll get two again! Wood stuck out an arm and only succeeded in deflecting it into space
back-of-the-hand slowie, Agar pulls in the air through midwicket, just one to the man in the deep
full length, pace off in the channel, steered calmly through the covers by Marsh
full outside off, 84mph and drilled down the ground for four! Beats the dive of Archer at mid-off... and that might mean he doesn't have to bowl again, Australia almost home and hosed now
slower-ball bouncer, Agar waits for it and paddles around the corner to fine leg
pitched full, cutter on middle and leg and Marsh sends it straight to midwicket
fullish in the channel and Marsh steers one more carefully to mid-off, who's on his heels... scores are level but it will go down to the final over
pitched up on the stumps and dinked to midwicket
flung full outside off, 88mph/141kph and Marsh mistimes this into the ground to cover... another dot!

full on the stumps, 88mph and Marsh digs it out to mid-off, tip and run and the throw is wayward with Marsh short! But that will do, Australia win by five wickets - and they'll take the No. 1 ranking home with them
